meanings.definition: To give strength or courage to
meanings.sent1: The encouraging words from her coach were innerving before the big game.
meanings.sent2: The motivational speech innerved the team to push harder.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's inspiring message was truly innerving to all who heard it.
meanings.sent4: The music had an innerving effect on the crowd, lifting their spirits.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the sunrise was innerving, filling her with determination for the day ahead.

meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks were so innerving that the audience couldn't stop applauding.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the movie was innerving, keeping viewers on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the painting were innerving, capturing everyone's attention.

meanings.sent1: The fresh morning air innerved her, preparing her for the day ahead.
meanings.sent2: A cup of hot tea can innerve you on a cold winter day.
meanings.sent3: The energetic dance routine was innerving, bringing a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: The powerful speech innerved the crowd, filling them with renewed energy.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies was innerving, awakening her senses.
